title: Guardado de Cookies e Inicios de sesión
content:
Hace un par de dias fotmateé mi PC y desde entonces tengo un problema con Firefos que es mi navegador por defecto.

He comprobado que a èsar de que guarda las cookies y las contraseñas de los sitios, cada vez que inicio el navegador me solicita las claves de acceso a mis cuentas.

Como ejemplo, uso habitualmente WhatsApp Web, Google Drive, Amazon Cloud Drive, Facebook e Instagram, y se ha vuelto muy molesto que cada vez que inicio el navegador me pida las claves de acceso a estas cuentas a pesar de que tiene almacenadas las cookies y passwords de estos sitios.

¿Alguien me sabría decir si hay alguna solución?, la verdad es que solo me pasa en mi ordenador principal y no en mi portatil a pesar de tener el mismo sistema operativo y la misma versión de Mozilla Firefox (v.86.0).

Gracias Paco Ortega https://www.ebyn.es
creator: paco7

title: Imposible cargar el modulo criptografico dnie en firefox
content:
1626 - Instalación manual del módulo criptográfico en Firefox para MAC Para instalar el módulo criptográfico en Firefox, sigo los pasos que se indican en la pagina web de la Real Casa de la Moneda en los trámites para obtener certificados digitales:

Voy a Firefox, Preferencias, Privacidad y Seguridad, botón dispositivos de Seguridad. Selecciono Cargar. Le doy un nombre al módulo: DNIE Módulo P11 Selecciono el módulo que está correctamente descargado desde la Biblioteca:

/Library/Libpkcs11-fnmtdnie/lib/libpkcs11-fnmtdnie.so

Le doy en el botón Aceptar

y me dice que NO ES POSIBLE AÑADIR EL MODULO
creator: idoiananda

title: Unable to access firefox browser. Get error message  <menuitem id+"spell-no-suggestions"
content: What do I do? Have had no problems for years with firefox.
creator: tedherman911

title: Enable/disable automatic redirect.
content: So I was having some trouble a few days ago with a website that automatically re-directed as soon as I landed on it to another page. So I happily went off in the settings and disable the automatic redirect. Now a week or two later I'm sitting here going I can't find the setting anymore? I can't even search for it and have absolutely no results you would think searching for "redirect" in the settings pain would bring it up. it's probably something that got buried in developer tools that I would never be able to turn off/toggle again unless I get lucky with the right extremely memorable and easily accessible incantation in the about : config because that's just all so well documented. Is it a "1" is it a "0" is it a "5" which one disabled / enabled what is the other options do?

title: How to switching multiple addon at once
content:
I want to switching on/off multiple extension at once, but built-in addon management is not capable of it (even swiping out disable addon when switched) , and there are no addon doing it.

I imagines like this , which doing preset type of management.

Any help?
creator: bleepblopp

title: Firefox sync not working correctly?
content:
Hi all - having an issue with Firefox sync...

I have a Windows desktop, a Linux desktop, two Linux laptops and an Android phone...all running Firefox and signed into the same Firefox account.

I've got them all set to sync bookmarks, but I've noticed that I'll often add a bookmark, organize it into a folder on one machine and then it will either never sync onto my other machines, or it will simply sync into the Bookmarks Menu rather than into whatever folder I had organized it into on all my other machines...

Is there a way to get it working properly on all my machines?

Thanks!
creator: Darkstrike

title: Resizing bookmark column width doesn't work
content:
User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10.14; rv:86.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/86.0

Steps to reproduce: 1.Opening bookmark by command-shift-o 2.Dragging boundary line of bookmark column (name, url, added date...) to resize the width

Expected results: The width of column is changed

Actual results: The width doesn't changed properly. The column next to dragged one is changed or completely ignores change at all.
creator: bleepblopp

title: Problem with two-sided printing
content: With "print on both sides" checked, the "backside" of each page is printed inverted top to bottom. I believe this began after the latest update. I'd like to revert to the old, more conventional, and (for me, at least) easier-to-use older system.
creator: rverga

title: "new tab + sign" moved to far right
content:
The new tab + sign, until now located immediately after the last open tab, has moved to the far right of the tab bar. Although it is still usable, I prefer the old location. Was this an (un/)intentional change by Firefox or is it a glitch? Is there a way to restore it to its original position? I read the similar question by GrokSurf (9/1/17): https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1173831 and the solutions presented didn't seem to apply to my situation: -The only things on my tab bar are my tabs and, to the far right, the print and new tab buttons. -My theme is the default theme. -I opened Firefox in safe mode and the new tab button was still on the far right.

Any help will be appreciated!

FF v 86.0 Windows 10 Home
creator: DeElmo

title: Print
content:
in the new version of Firefox 86.0 the " print preview " has been removed = WHY??? 

I now have to install an additional add-on again!

I don't understand why this was done, what sense or logic does it make? And can't even Firefox run for a few months without a change?

What advice could you give me on how to get back to the old "print preview"?

The logic that remains for me is to change the browser soon.

With kind regards

anton
